DOCNAME: CASE OF RAKIĆ AND SARVAN v. SERBIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in Požega .
CARDINAL . They were employed by ORG , a socially - owned company based in PERSON ( hereinafter “ the debtor ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the debtor to pay the first applicant specified amounts on account of salary arrears and social insurance contributions , plus the costs of the civil proceedings . This judgment became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE upon the first applicant ’s request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the first applicant the enforcement costs .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the debtor to pay the first applicant specified amounts on account of salary arrears and social insurance contributions , plus the costs of the civil proceedings . This judgment became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE upon the first applicant ’s request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the first applicant the enforcement costs .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the debtor to pay the first applicant specified amounts on account of salary arrears and social insurance contributions , plus the costs of the civil proceedings . This judgment became final by DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE upon the first applicant ’s request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the first applicant the enforcement costs .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the debtor to pay the second applicant specified amounts on account of salary arrears and social insurance contributions , plus the costs of the civil proceedings . This judgment became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE upon the second applicant ’s request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the second applicant the enforcement costs .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the debtor to pay the second applicant specified amounts on account of salary arrears and social insurance contributions , plus the costs of the civil proceedings . This judgment became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE upon the second applicant ’s request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the second applicant the enforcement costs .
CARDINAL . The debtor , which operated as a socially - owned company , was privatised on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the privatisation was annulled because the buyer in question had failed to fulfil his contractual obligations .
CARDINAL . Following the annulment of the debtor ’s privatisation the ORG owned PERCENT of shares in the company .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG sold its shares to a private company .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor . As a result , all of the ongoing enforcement proceedings against the debtor were stayed .
CARDINAL . The applicants duly reported their respective claims based on the above - mentioned judgments to the insolvency administration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG recognized a part of the ORG claims .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE and DATE some of the judgments at issue had been partially enforced in the insolvency proceedings .
CARDINAL . The insolvency proceedings are still ongoing .
